content: I'm guessing that announcing Trump as the key note today means that it's rock solid that the event is going ahead
That will be interesting. Will he dismiss COVID-19 as 'Fake News' or a Democrat Party Plot?
not sure. But it will be the greatest crowd ever at a HIMSS key note

7 days of incremental updates on confirmed cases and deaths, with a trickle of companies pulling out of the conference, is a long time. I don't think the Trump administration has gamed this out to the point where it's rock solid.

I don't think the Trump administration has gamed this out to the point where it's rock solid

Who'd a thought that?

Unless the major EHRs start pulling out, the event is going ahead. Cisco and Adobe have left but they're not the big voices for this kind of thing. The fact that HL7 pulled out was surprising but I'm sure the team thought long and hard about it first.

Grahame Grieve said:

I don't think the Trump administration has gamed this out to the point where it's rock solid

Who'd a thought that?

New flash at 1600 Pennsylvania Ave: OMG the virus can't be threatened, humiliated, bribed or fired! Those are the only tools in our playbook!
it can't be spun either
Actually, it can - the virus can run its natural course and the Trump administration can take credit for saving all of us.
Most certainly would!

Grahame Grieve said:

I'm guessing that announcing Trump as the key note today means that it's rock solid that the event is going ahead

Is this actually the opening keynote? From HealthcareIT News::

His HIMSS20 speech is currently scheduled for Monday, March 9, at 4 p.m. in the Valencia Ballroom of the Orange County Convention Center.

(btw, that timing surely explains why the Monday training for Interop Showcase volunteers got moved from 2-4 to 1-3.)

And @Grahame Grieve that overlaps your closing talk at HealthDevJam! I'll pick your session for sure.

A thought: What if he was the only big-draw voice that was WILLING to come at the last minute?? Remember, this is the guy who stared directly at an eclipse ...
image.png

This really is odd, though, since he's a well known germaphobe.

Actually, it can - the virus can run its natural course and the Trump administration can take credit for saving all of us.

Apart from those that died, but that's the fault of the Democrats...

I'll pick your session for sure

well, wow. thanks.
Is this scheduled by ONC to enable Trump to announce the new rule?
Surely he is already down there golfing, he will show up in his golfing outfit
Is HIMSS the official launch for GRIEVE 2020?
Kinda late entering in after Super Tuesday but could play as a brokered convention strategy
"Ask not how your country can interoperate for you but how you can interoperate for your country"
He's going to announce he's appointed Barron Trump the new NAtional Coordinator.

Is HIMSS the official launch for GRIEVE 2020?

pfft. Actually, right now, I'm leaning towards not going to USA. My principle concern is that I will only come if I'm sure I can get home
If not, you're welcome to hide in Canada until it all blows over.
hah. well, that'd be lovely, except it's winter
oh. no, whoops, except that my family isn't in Canada
perhaps they would like a break from the heat?
IT's hardly winter. It was 4 degrees and raining today.
Rode my bike to work today... good enough!

IT's hardly winter. It was 4 degrees and raining today.

Sounds like May in Melbourne
20 years ago
@James Agnew I expect you ride your bike to work when it's -30... ;)
Ha! I truly admire those people, but 0 is my cutoff.
365 or nothing!
0 Kelvin ? ;-)

It is my patriotic duty as a Canadian to make the following joke:

Ya right, at 0 Kelvin it's so cold out that I put on a hat.
